name: ext_R5_Procedure_reason
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.Procedure.reason for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents Procedure.reason from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Procedure|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: The justification that the procedure was performed
element.definition: The coded reason or reference why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, be present as text, or be a reference to one of several resources that justify the procedure.
element.comment: `Procedure.notDoneReason` maps to R2 `Procedure.reasonNotPerformed`. Changed from a single value to an array (max cardinality from 1 to *). So is mapped as SourceIsNarrowerThanTarget. `Procedure.reasonCode` maps to R2 `Procedure.reason[x]`.  Changed from an array to a single value (max cardinality from * to 1). So is mapped as RelatedTo. `Procedure.reasonReference` maps to R2 `Procedure.reason[x]`. Target removed Reference target profiles: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation Added the types: `CodeableConcept` Changed from an array to a single value (max cardinality from * to 1). So is mapped as RelatedTo.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
